Name: Statue of King Senusert the First
Description: This small wooden statue of King Senusert the First was found in a private tomb. It consists of several pieces joined together with wooden pins. The king wears the white Crown of Upper Egypt and holds in his left hand the Heka, crook-shaped scepter of the ruler, while his right hand might have held the Sekhem scepter, symbol of authority. His kilt is plastered and painted white.
